In addition to cyclodextrin derivatives, macrocyclic calix[4]arene derivatives also showed promising virucidal activities. 1,3‐bis(bithiazolyl)‐tetra‐para‐sulfonato‐calix[4]arene (C[4]S‐BTZ) (Figure 7B) was shown to show better virucidal activities against human coronavirus HCoV‐229E than the frequently used antiseptic, chlorhexidine (CHX) (Section 3.5).
107 Firstly, C[4]S‐BTZ were not cytotoxic towards L‐132 cells, whereas CHX and HXM showed notable toxicities with IC 50 values of 4.3 × 10 −6 and 3.8 × 10 −5 mol/L, respectively. In addition, C[4]S‐BTZ demonstrated a faster virucidal rate as compared to CHX
107 . At a concentration of 10 −3 mol/L, a 5 min‐incubation of HcoV‐229E with C[4]S‐BTZ reduced viral titers by 2.7 log 10 units, as compared to just 1.4 log 10 reduction for the same concentration and duration of CHX.
